scenario:
The surface radars market is projected to reach USD 22.49 billion by 2029, from USD 17.26 billion in 2024, at a CAGR of 5.4%. The volume of surface radars is projected to grow from 4690 (in Units) in 2024 to 6113 (in Units) by 2029. The market is driven by key factors including US defense programs to counter threats, a surge in demand due to ongoing conflicts, and global defense expenditure. 

The market faces challenges from regulations on arms transfers, operational complexities requiring maintenance, and the development costs of missile systems. The X-Band frequency segment is estimated to capture the largest share in the market during the forecast period, with higher application in both military and commercial domains. 

The FMCW radar segment is likely to achieve the highest CAGR in the forecast period, with advances made in FMCW radars supporting real-time target identification with high-resolution imaging. The Europe region is estimated to be the largest market during the forecast period, driven by several key factors including the presence of leading defense contractors and the need for advanced radar technologies to improve air and missile defense systems.

The report provides insights on key drivers, restrains, opportunities, and challenges influencing the growth of the market, as well as a detailed analysis of key industry players including Lockheed Martin Corporation, RTX, BAE Systems, Northrop Grumman, L3Harris Corporation, and others. 

The report covers the following regions: Global, with a focus on the Europe region. The report also provides information on the following companies: RTX, Lockheed Martin Corporation, L3Harris Technologies, Inc., Thales, Israel Aerospace Industries, Leonardo S.P.A., BAE Systems, Northrop Grumman, Elbit Systems Ltd., Bharat Electronics Limited, Indra, Aselsan A.S., Saab, Teledyne Flir LLC, Hensoldt, Blighter Surveillance Systems Limited, Detect, Inc., Terma, Accipiter Radar, Piersight, Reutech Radar Systems, Src Inc., Easat Radar Systems Limited, Echodyne Corp., Magos Systems.
